孝.definition: filial piety or obedience; mourning apparel

孝南.definition: Xiaonan district of Xiaogan city 孝感市[Xiao4 gan3 shi4], Hubei

孝南區.definition: Xiaonan district of Xiaogan city 孝感市[Xiao4 gan3 shi4], Hubei

孝廉.definition: xiaolian, two examination subjects in Han, later a single subject in Ming and Qing; successful second degree candidate

孝心.definition: filial piety (a Confucian obligation); respect and obedience to one's parents

孝悌忠信.definition: Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity; piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends

孝感市.definition: Xiaogan, prefecture-level city in Hubei Province 湖北省[Hu2bei3 Sheng3]

孝成王.definition: King Xiaocheng of Zhao 趙國|赵国, reigned 266-245 BC

孝敬.definition: to show filial respect; to give presents (to one's elders or superiors); to support one's aged parents

孝昌.definition: Xiaochang county in Xiaogan 孝感[Xiao4 gan3], Hubei

孝昌縣.definition: Xiaochang county in Xiaogan 孝感[Xiao4 gan3], Hubei

孝義.definition: Xiaoyi, county-level city in Lüliang 呂梁|吕梁[Lu:3 liang2], Shanxi 山西

孝義市.definition: Xiaoyi, county-level city in Lüliang 呂梁|吕梁[Lu:3 liang2], Shanxi 山西

孝聖憲.definition: Empress Xiaoshengxian (1693-1777), consort of Emperor Yongzheng 雍正[Yong1 zheng4] and mother of Emperor Qianlong 乾隆[Qian2 long2]

孝肅.definition: Xiaosu, posthumous name of Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty

孝道.definition: filial piety (Confucian virtue); to be a good son or daughter

孝順.definition: filial; dutiful; devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc); to show filial piety towards (an older family member); filial piety
